section.heading: Scope.
section.text: Except for a gas company providing standard Commission rate regulated gas sales or delivery service, this subtitle applies to all gas suppliers.

para.text: In this subtitle, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.

“Affiliate” means a person that directly or indirectly, or through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, is under common control with, or has any economic interest in another person.
Aggregator.
“Aggregator” means an entity or an individual that acts on behalf of a customer to purchase gas.
“Aggregator” does not include:
An entity or individual that purchases gas for its own use or for the use of its subsidiaries or affiliates;
A municipal gas utility serving only in its distribution territory; or
A combination of governmental units that purchases gas for use by the governmental units.
“Applicant” means a person applying for a gas supplier license.
“Application” means a written request for a gas supplier license.
“Broker” means an entity or individual that acts as an agent or intermediary in the sale and purchase of gas but does not take title to the gas.
“Commission” means the Public Service Commission of Maryland.
“Competitive billing service” means the:
Invoicing for gas supply or gas supply services to a retail customer; and
Processing of payment for gas supply or gas supply services to a retail customer.

“Contract for energy assistance households” means a residential retail energy supply contract that meets the legal requirements of Public Utilities Article, §4-308, Annotated Code of Maryland, and any other applicable requirements in the Public Utilities Article in connection with a supplier’s supply service for customers who are part of an energy assistance household.

“Energy assistance household” means that the Office of Home Energy Programs found that the service address or household associated with the utility account qualified for a gas assistance program during the current or previous fiscal year. For a utility that provides both gas and electric service, an energy assistance household means that the Office of Home Energy Programs found that the service address or household associated with the utility account qualified for an electric or gas assistance program during the current or previous fiscal year.

“Energy assistance program” means the following programs administered by the Maryland Office of Home Energy Programs by which a customer receives financial assistance paying their gas utility bills, which includes but is not necessarily limited to:
The Maryland Energy Assistance Program;
The Utility Service Protection Program; and
The Arrearage Retirement Assistance Program.
“Fiscal year” means the 12-month period that begins on July 1 of a calendar year and ends June 30 of the next calendar year.

“Gas commodity price or net purchased gas charge” means the utility rate for a given period as approved in the utility’s applicable sales service tariff that would be charged to a utility gas commodity customer, excluding any charges, adjustments, riders, or taxes related to distribution rates.
“Gas company” has the meaning stated in Public Utilities Article, §1-101, Annotated Code of Maryland.
Gas Supplier.
“Gas supplier” means a licensed person that:
Sells gas, gas supply services, or competitive billing services; or
Purchases, brokers, arranges, or markets, including by means of supplier-consolidated billing, gas or gas supply services for sale to a retail gas customer.
“Gas supplier” includes an aggregator, a broker, and a marketer of gas.
“Gas supplier” does not include:
A gas company to the extent that the gas company provides gas sales or delivery service at rates regulated by the Commission;
An owner/operator that holds ownership in and manages the internal distribution system serving a building, and supplies gas solely to occupants of the building for use by the occupants;
A lessee/operator that holds a leasehold interest in and manages the internal distribution system serving a building, and supplies gas solely to occupants of the building for use by the occupants; or
A person that transmits or distributes gas within a site owned by the person or the person's affiliate that is incidental to the primary landlord-tenant relationship.
“License” means the authority granted by the Commission to a person to do business as a gas supplier.
“Marketer” means a person that purchases and takes title to gas as an intermediary for sale to a customer.
“Person” means an individual, receiver, trustee, guardian, personal representative, fiduciary, or representative of any kind and any partnership, firm, association, corporation, or other entity.
Retail Gas Customer.
“Retail gas customer” means a purchaser of gas for end use in the State.

“Retail gas customer” does not include an occupant of a building in which the owner or operator or lessee or operator manages the internal distribution system serving the building and supplies gas and gas supply services solely to occupants of the building for use by the occupants.
“Sales service” means the supply of retail gas commodity service by the customer’s gas company.

“Supplier-consolidated billing (SCB)” means a form of competitive billing service in which a gas or electricity supplier is authorized by the Commission to render a bill to a retail gas or electric customer that includes both the supplier charges and the gas or electric company's regulated charges.
